chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kawane A. Weaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide a DNA sample.

No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kawane A. Weaver

records.addlTxt: Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on July 27, 2022
Removing repeater enhancer as amended in court.

10:30 AM cases 22CF152 and 22CF160 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kawane A. Weaver appeared by phone, in custody (Dodge Correctional).  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Kawane A. Weaver. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In 22CF152: Defendant pleads Guilty to Amended Count 1: Possession w/ Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (2nd/Subsequent). 
In 22CF160: Defendant pleads Guilty to Amended Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. Attorney Kirkpatrick makes a statement before sentencing. 
In 22CF152: Defendant is sentenced to 4 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision. 
In 22CF160: Defendant is sentenced to 1.5 years initial confinement and 1.5 years extended supervision. 
Sentences run concurrent to one another. Defendant is eligible for SAP and is not eligible for CIP in both files. 
In 22CF160: Defendant has 134 days sentence credit.  In 22CF152: Defendant has 126 days sentence credit. 
Conditions of extended supervision include: 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Provide a DNA sample. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges.
Status conference on July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cases called at 2:39 PM: 22CF152, 22CF160. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing and in person.
Defendant Kawane A. Weaver appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional. Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Kawane A. Weaver.   Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin.    
22CF152: Attorney Cook indicates that a resolution is likely and requests the trial be removed from the calendar. Court so orders.
Parties stipulate to move the trial in 22CF160 to 8/30 through 9/1 with 22CF152 to ride along.
STC: 7/27/22 at 10:30 AM (Defendant to appear via Zoom).
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum for a hearing on 07/18/2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Proposed Writ of Habeas Corpus
Defendant's Motion in Limine
State's Motion to Impeach Defendant with Prior Convictions
Amended Notice of State's Witnesses and Intent to Use Expert Witness
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:39 AM cases 22CF152 and 22CF160 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kawane A. Weaver in court, in custody.  Attorney Kate Cook for Zebulon Patek in court for Kawane A. Weaver. Defense asks for another status conference. A Status conference is scheduled for 7/7/22 at 2:30 PM.
Notice of State's Witnesses and Intent to Use Expert Witness
State's Requested Jury Instructions
State's Motion in Limine
Jury trial - 12 person on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 22CF152, 22CF160 are called at 2:01 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Kawane A. Weaver appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Kawane A. Weaver. Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests to set the cases for jury trial. Discussion held regarding scheduling. 
Final Status Conference in both case: 06/07/2022 at 9:30 AM (during intake). Jury Trial in 22CF160: 07/18/2022- 07/20/2022. Jury Trial in 22CF152: 08/30/2022- 09/01/2022.
Status conference on May 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Cases called at 3:57 PM: 22CF152, 22CF160.
Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Kawane A. Weaver appeared in custody, by video from the jail.  Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Kawane A. Weaver. 
Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Patek requests a 30 day extension to file motions.
Scheduling Conference: 5/9/22 at 2:00 PM.
Status conference on April 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

(Cases 22CF160, 22CF152 are called at 9:36 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Kawane A. Weaver appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared in court for Kawane A. Weaver, Attorney Afton Lewis appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Informations in 22CF160, 22CF152, waives reading, enters Not Guilty pleas in 22CF160, 22CF152. Court accepts Not Guilty pleas. 
Further scheduling with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
Arraignment on March 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Same as Complaint.

Cases called at 1:32 PM: 22CF152, 22CF160.
Defendant Kawane A. Weaver appeared by video, in custody from the jail, Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared in court for Kawane A. Weaver, Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to personal appearance.
22CF160: Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. 
22CF152: State calls Officer Lucas Tisold of the ECPD to the stand. He is sworn and testifies. Officer identifies the Defendant. Cross examination by Defense. Witness excused.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 to schedule ARGNs.
Preliminary hearing on February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with Regency Inn & Suites, C.H. (telephone contact to speak with his child is allowed)
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF152 & 22CM75)

Cases called at 11:06 AM: 22CF152, 22CM75.
Defendant Kawane A. Weaver appeared by video, in custody from the jail, Attorney Sonia Anderson by video from the jail, Attorney Robert Stoiber appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  
State requests a $10,000 Cash Bond to cover both cases (Trafficking meth, flight risk, facing significant exposure). Court orders $10,000 Cash Bond to cover 22CF152 and 22CM75.
22CF75 Preliminary Hearing: 2/15/22 at 1:30 PM with 22CM75 to ride along.
